title: Australia’s splashy new tourism ad
text:
Email a friend 
EXCLUSIVE 
AUSTRALIA is set to be sold as the world’s biggest waterpark in a new tourism campaign being shot around the country. 
Locations in Queensland and South Australia will dominate the promotion although every state and territory is featured in some way. 
From swimming with dolphins at Glenelg to snorkelling on the Great Barrier Reef, Tourism Australia has chosen a dozen sites to try to reignite interest in aquatic and coastal experiences. 
It follows a downturn in online searches for Australian beaches and waterways that has triggered alarm bells among tourism bodies. Memorable ... Swimming with Sea Lions in Baird Bay on the Eyre Peninsula of South Australia. Picture: John Montesi/South Australian Tourism Corporation. Source: Supplied 
Tourism Australia Managing Director John O’Sullivan said Australia was increasingly facing “stiff competition from countries such as South Africa, Hawaii and the US, which were all raising their game”. 
“Aquatic and coastal experiences have always been an important part of the Australia story but they’ve never before taken centre stage,” Mr O’Sullivan said. 
“This campaign will do just that by putting aquatic and coastal Australia on the main stage.” 
Other locations being used to entice overseas visitors are Lake Burley Griffin in Canberra, Sydney Harbour, Katherine Gorge in the Northern Territory and Victoria’s Twelve Apostles. Rolling ... Filming underway at Edith Falls at Katherine in the Northern Territory. Picture: Tourism Australia. Source: Supplied 
The production and filming is expected to cost around $5 million. 
Tourism Australia will then spend another $40 million rolling out the campaign in key markets such as China, the US, the UK, New Zealand and Japan. 
Northern Territory Chief Minister Adam Giles said it was the first time a stand-alone destination in the Top End was featured in a global tourism campaign. 
“The exposure for the Katherine region will be huge with the campaign and Katherine images and videos to be seen by millions of people in all of Tourism Australia’s key global markets,” Mr Giles said. 
Tourism and Events Queensland CEO Leanne Coddington said the state’s aquatic and coastal experiences were worthy of a place on the world stage. 
“From surfing the white sandy stretches of the Gold Coast to sailing the Whitsundays and diving the Great Barrier Reef, Queensland has the best aquatic and coastal experiences in the world,” said Ms Coddington. 
“We want to inspire global travellers to come here for authentic and amazing experiences you wouldn’t get anywhere else, and to share them with family and friends.” Awestruck ... View from the Gibson Steps beach, Twelve Apostles Lodge Walk. Picture: Great Walks of Australia. Source: Supplied 
Just as chuffed was South Australian Tourism Minister Leon Bignell, who said their coastline was among the state’s greatest assets. 
“Our coasts and clean waters provide some of the world’s best seafood as well as unique tourism experiences such as shark cage diving,” said Minister Bignell. 
“Hopefully the campaign will convince more travellers to visit our state and enjoy everything it has to offer.” 
Despite only scoring one site in the campaign, New South Wales Tourism Minister Stuart Ayres said there were many remarkable aquatic and coastal journeys to experience in the state. 
“From our World Heritage Listed paradise Lord Howe Island, to our iconic beaches Bondi and Manly, and the rivers, waterfalls and lakes that shimmer inland,” Mr Ayres said. 
“Tourism is an important industry for NSW, contributing $29.5 billion in visitor expenditure to the state’s economy in the past financial year.” 
Mr O’Sullivan said Australia would get its first look at the completed campaign early next year, and it would then be rolled out to key markets including China, Japan, New Zealand, India, North America, the UK and Europe. Water world ... The Great Barrier Reef takes centre stage in Australia’s new ad campaign. Picture: Supplied Source: Supplied 
Sites featured in Tourism Australia’s new Coastal and Aquatic experiences campaign: 
1. ACT — Lake Burley Griffin and a scenic trip of the Capital 
2. NSW — Sydney Harbour and beach / cafe surrounds 
3. NT — Katherine Gorge and Indigenous experiences 
4. QLD — Relaxing on a sand cay and snorkelling on Great Barrier Reef 
5. QLD — Gold Coast beach experience 
6. QLD — Whitehaven (The Whitsundays) 
7. SA — Kangaroo Island experience including food and wine 
8. SA — Swim with dolphins at Glenelg 
9. SA — Swimming with sea lions 
10. TAS — The Three Capes Track Walking Experience 
11. VIC — Helicopter ride over the Twelve Apostles 
12. WA — Freemantle, Cottesloe and journey to Rottnest Island
